title: Katie Price's Rules For Living aged 12 reveal she promised not to take drugs or cheat

Katie Price has unearthed the life guide she wrote to herself when she was a child - but how many of her ten rules has she kept to?

The 41-year-old shared the laws she vowed to stick to as a 12-year-old after stumbling across some of her old notes over the weekend.

Her Rules For Living include, thankfully, not to murder anyone.

She also says that she should worship no god but hers - and also not to swear.

She should always respect her mother and father, and not commit adultery.

(Image: Instagram)

(Image: SplashNews.com)

Also on her list was not to falsely accuse anyone - and she was also not to envy another person.

No stealing was high up, as was keeping Saturdays free.

Well, she didn't say anything about not enjoying a drink or two on a night out.

She was reportedly thrown out of a London club late last week after a boozy session with her ex Dane Bowers.

She looked worse for wear at Jakata - slumping against a wall after knocking back the drinks.

(Image: CRYSTAL PIX / SplashNews.com)

(Image: Instagram)

A source told The Sun Online : "Katie turned up to support Dane's new band Boyz On Block, but she was a total nightmare.

"She was rampaging around the place and demanding shots of Limoncello.

"Katie even snuck behind the bar to take drinks when the staff weren't looking.

"By the end, enough was enough and she had to go."

(Image: Brett D. Cove / Splash News)

After recovering, she posted more throwback pictures over the weekend and revealed what she wrote when she was 13

"When I grow up I hope to find a nice good looking man with lots of money and I want to own riding stables and travel around the world," she scribbled.

"I want to be a secretary as well, but already I have had three horses so that's a start and a big house with a swimming pool and stables and a sand school."
description: The star shared a cute throwback to when she was young after finding her life notes from childhood
